abstract: Initializes a table cell with a style and a reuse identifier and returns it to the caller.
overview:
## Return Value

An initialized [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableViewCell] object or `nil` if the object could not be created.

## Discussion

This method is the designated initializer for the class. The reuse identifier is associated with those cells (rows) of a table view that have the same general configuration, minus cell content. In its implementation of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableViewDataSource/tableView(_:cellForRowAt:)], the table view’s data source calls the `UITableView` method [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableView/dequeueReusableCell(withIdentifier:)], passing in a reuse identifier, to obtain the cell object to use as the basis for the current row.

If you want a table cell that has a configuration different that those defined by `UITableViewCell` for `style`, you must create your own custom cell. If you want to set the row height of cells on an individual basis, implement the delegate method [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableViewDelegate/tableView(_:heightForRowAt:)].

# init(style:reuseIdentifier:)

**Initializer**

Initializes a table cell with a style and a reuse identifier and returns it to the caller.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor init(style: UITableViewCell.CellStyle, reuseIdentifier: String?)
```

## Parameters

- **style**: A constant indicating a cell style. See [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableViewCell/CellStyle] for descriptions of these constants.
- **reuseIdentifier**: A string used to identify the cell object if it is to be reused for drawing multiple rows of a table view. Pass `nil` if the cell object is not to be reused. You should use the same reuse identifier for all cells of the same form.

## Return Value

An initialized [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableViewCell] object or `nil` if the object could not be created.

## Discussion

This method is the designated initializer for the class. The reuse identifier is associated with those cells (rows) of a table view that have the same general configuration, minus cell content. In its implementation of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableViewDataSource/tableView(_:cellForRowAt:)], the table view’s data source calls the `UITableView` method [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableView/dequeueReusableCell(withIdentifier:)], passing in a reuse identifier, to obtain the cell object to use as the basis for the current row.

If you want a table cell that has a configuration different that those defined by `UITableViewCell` for `style`, you must create your own custom cell. If you want to set the row height of cells on an individual basis, implement the delegate method [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableViewDelegate/tableView(_:heightForRowAt:)].

## Creating a table view cell

- **UITableViewCell.CellStyle**: An enumeration for the various styles of cells.
- **init(coder:)**: Creates a table view from data in an unarchiver.
